description: From French gnomique, ultimately from Ancient Greek γνωμικός (gnōmikós), from γνώμη (gnṓmē, “thought, judgement”), akin to γιγνώσκω (gignṓskō, “know”).

adjectives.description: gnomic (comparative more gnomic, superlative most gnomic)

entries.meaning: Of, or relating to gnomes (sententious sayings).
examples: a city long famous as the seat of elegiac and gnomic poetry

entries.meaning: (of a saying or aphorism) Mysterious and often incomprehensible yet seemingly wise.
